00001 #include <num.h>
00002 
00003 // Turn off all but first NUM LP
00004 #define ONE             0
00005 
00006 // Print VERIFY stmts for only this LP
00007 #define DEBUG_LP        504065
00008 
00009 /*
00010  * num_init: initialize the NUM LP
00011  */
00012 void
00013 num_init(num_state * state, tw_lp * lp)
00014 {
00015         state->stats = tw_vector_create(sizeof(num_statistics), 1);
00016         state->file_size = MIN_FILE_SIZE;
00017 }
00018 
00019 /*
00020  * num_update: invokes NUM update statistics
00021  *
00022  * Each network user must add it's stats to the global level table.
00023  * Therefore, if an agent attempted to utilize the network during the day,
00024  * we must create a timer event for midnight to record the stats.  This 
00025  * function is called when that timer fires.
00026  */
00027 void
00028 num_update(num_state * state, tw_bf * bf, rn_message * msg, tw_lp * lp)
00029 {
00030         num_profile     *np;
00031         float            tput;
00032 
00033         if(!g_num_log_f)
00034                 return;
00035 
00036         np = &g_num_profiles[state->type];
00037         tput = (state->stats->s_total_time > 0) ?
00038                         state->stats->s_total_kb / state->stats->s_total_time : 0.0;
00039 
00040         // is network on?
00041         if(g_num_mod > 0)
00042         {
00043                 if(state->stats->s_nfailures > 0)
00044                 {
00045                         g_num_level[state->type][state->stats->s_nfailures]++;
00046                 } else if(state->stats->s_total_kb > 0)
00047                 {
00048                         if (tput > np->bitrate)
00049                                 g_num_level[state->type][NUM_LEVEL_0]++;
00050                         else if (tput > np->bitrate/ 10)
00051                                 g_num_level[state->type][NUM_LEVEL_1]++;
00052                 }
00053         }
00054 
00055         // reset state variables
00056         state->stats->s_total_kb = 0; 
00057         state->stats->s_total_time = 0; 
00058         state->stats->s_nfailures = 0;
00059 }
00060 
00061 /*
00062  * num_start: invokes the NUM
00063  *
00064  * Right now, called when agent is added to home location by EPI during the
00065  * hours of 0900-QUIT_TIME.  Network users begin utilizing network during 
00066  * this period.  Of course we don't want the users to be perfectly synchronized
00067  * at 0900, so we add jitter to the start time using a timer event.  Jitter is
00068  * currently determined via an exponential random distribution around ONE_MINUTE.
00069  *
00070  * We always create a timer event for midnight so we can update the global stats.
00071  */
00072 void
00073 num_start(num_state * state, tw_bf * bf, rn_message * msg, tw_lp * lp)
00074 {
00075         tw_event        *e;
00076         tw_stime         ts;
00077 
00078         rn_message      *m;
00079 
00080         int              today;
00081         int              timeofday;
00082 
00083         today = (int) tw_now(lp) / TWENTY_FOUR_HOURS;;
00084         timeofday = (int) tw_now(lp) % TWENTY_FOUR_HOURS;
00085 
00086         // set file size to zero for beginning
00087         state->file_size = MIN_FILE_SIZE;
00088 
00089         // num_starts recv'd after midnight, so report previous days results
00090         num_report_levels(tw_now(lp) / TWENTY_FOUR_HOURS);
00091 
00092         // only send to QUIT_TIME each day (e.g., 10:00 am)
00093         if(timeofday >= QUIT_TIME)
00094                 return;
00095 
00096         // update network population here
00097         g_num_net_pop[state->type]++;
00098 
00099         // if NETWORK is off, then done
00100         if(g_num_mod == 0)
00101         {
00102                 if(timeofday >= NINE_OCLOCK)
00103                 {
00104                         state->stats->s_nstart++;
00105 
00106                         // update report log
00107                         g_num_level[state->type][NUM_LEVEL_0]++;
00108                 }
00109 
00110                 return;
00111         }
00112 
00113 #if ONE
00114         if(lp->id != DEBUG_LP)
00115                 return;
00116 #endif
00117 
00118         // if not mod day, then do not need to start anything
00119         if(g_num_mod > 1 && (today % g_num_mod)+1 != g_num_mod)
00120                 return;
00121 
00122         // first file of the day
00123         state->file_size = MIN_FILE_SIZE; 
00124 
00125         // If before 9:00 AM set a timer to start at 9:00
00126         if(timeofday < NINE_OCLOCK)
00127         {
00128                 ts = tw_now(lp) + NINE_OCLOCK - timeofday 
00129                                 + tw_rand_unif(lp->id) * ONE_MINUTE;
00130 
00131                 if((int) ts % TWENTY_FOUR_HOURS >= QUIT_TIME)
00132                         tw_error(TW_LOC, "Next file request past quit time!");
00133 
00134                 rn_timer_init(lp, ts);
00135         } else if (timeofday == NINE_OCLOCK)
00136         {
00137                 // jitter time a liitle bit and start with small file
00138                 ts = tw_now(lp) + tw_rand_unif(lp->id) * ONE_MINUTE;
00139 
00140                 if((int) ts % TWENTY_FOUR_HOURS >= QUIT_TIME)
00141                         tw_error(TW_LOC, "Next file request past quit time!");
00142 
00143                 rn_timer_init(lp, ts);
00144         } else
00145         {
00146                 num_file_start(state, bf, MIN_FILE_SIZE, lp);
00147         }
00148 
00149         // create the stats update timer, and override the TTL value 
00150         // in the rn_message data to indicate the event type
00151         e = rn_timer_init(lp, (today + 1) * 86400);
00152         m = tw_event_data(e);
00153         m->ttl = 2;
00154 }
00155 
00156 /*
00157  * num_event_handler: main event handler for NUM
00158  *
00159  * Event types:
00160  *
00161  *      UPSTREAM - event from transport layer
00162  *      TIMER    - set by NUM to start next file send
00163  *      TTL = 2  - event from EPI indicating midnight (update NUM stats)
00164  *      TTL = 1  - event from EPI indicating start of NUM for day
00165  *      ELSE     - event from EPI indicating end of NUM for day
00166  */
00167 void
00168 num_event_handler(num_state * state, tw_bf * bf, rn_message * msg, tw_lp * lp)
00169 {
00170         if(msg->type == UPSTREAM)
00171                 num_file_complete(state, bf, msg, lp);
00172         else if(msg->ttl == 2)
00173                 num_update(state, bf, msg, lp);
00174         else if(msg->type == TIMER)
00175                 num_file_start(state, bf, state->file_size, lp);
00176         else if(msg->ttl == 1)
00177                 num_start(state, bf, msg, lp);
00178         else
00179                 num_file_stop(state, bf, lp);
00180 }
00181 
00182 /*
00183  * num_rc_event_handler: REVERSE COMPUTATION event handler for NUM
00184  */
00185 void
00186 num_rc_event_handler(num_state * state, tw_bf * bf, rn_message * msg, tw_lp * lp)
00187 {
00188         tw_error(TW_LOC, "NUM Model cannot be run with more than 1 CPU!");
00189 }

00191 /*
00192  * num_final: finalize NUM
00193  */
00194 void
00195 num_final(num_state * state, tw_lp * lp)
00196 {
00197         // print out final days worth of statistics
00198         if(g_num_mod != -172)
00199         {
00200                 num_print();
00201                 g_num_mod = -172;
00202         }
00203 
00204         g_num_stats->s_nstop += state->stats->s_nstop;
00205         g_num_stats->s_nstart += state->stats->s_nstart;
00206         g_num_stats->s_nfiles += state->stats->s_nfiles;
00207 }
